intro: Rubus tokyensis, commonly known as the Japanese raspberry, is a species of brambles native to Japan. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters. The plant produces small, red, edible berries that are similar in appearance to raspberries. Its leaves are compound, consisting of three to five elliptical leaflets with serrated edges. Rubus tokyensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
